unnormalised: **Yoga Practices: Beyond the Asanas - How to Integrate Yoga into Your Lifestyle & Wellness**
normalised: **Yoga Practices: Beyond the Asanas - How to Integrate Yoga into Your Lifestyle & Wellness**

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Lately, I've been thinking a lot about yoga. It's so much more than just striking a pose, right? It's a whole lifestyle. I see so many people in Mumbai cramming yoga classes after work, rushing back to their demanding jobs, and I wonder, are we really getting the full benefit?
normalised: Hey everyone! Lately, I've been thinking a lot about yoga. It's so much more than just striking a pose, right? It's a whole lifestyle. I see so many people in Mumbai cramming yoga classes after work, rushing back to their demanding jobs, and I wonder, are we really getting the full benefit?

unnormalised: For me, yoga practices extend way beyond those 60-minute sessions at the local studio (shoutout to Yogshala at Bandra!). It's about bringing the principles of yoga into your daily routine. Think about it:
normalised: For me, yoga practices extend way beyond those sixty-minute sessions at the local studio (shoutout to Yogshala at Bandra!). It's about bringing the principles of yoga into your daily routine. Think about it:

unnormalised: *   **Mindfulness:** Start your day with a few minutes of meditation. Even just 5 minutes can make a huge difference! I use the Headspace app, but finding a quiet corner in your house (even if it's just a tiny 100 sq ft space!) can work wonders.
normalised: *   **Mindfulness:** Start your day with a few minutes of meditation. Even just five minutes can make a huge difference! I use the Headspace app, but finding a quiet corner in your house (even if it's just a tiny one hundred square feet space!) can work wonders.

unnormalised: *   **Diet:** Are you eating mindfully? Ayurveda encourages us to eat foods that are sattvic, promoting clarity and peace. Ditch the processed junk and embrace whole foods. Think homemade dal and roti instead of a Rs. 200 burger!
normalised: *   **Diet:** Are you eating mindfully? Ayurveda encourages us to eat foods that are sattvic, promoting clarity and peace. Ditch the processed junk and embrace whole foods. Think homemade dal and roti instead of a rupee two hundred burger!

unnormalised: *   **Ethical Living:** Yama and Niyama guide our interactions with the world. Am I being honest, kind, and non-violent in my words and actions?
normalised: *   **Ethical Living:** Yama and Niyama guide our interactions with the world. Am I being honest, kind, and non-violent in my words and actions?

unnormalised: My grandmother, Dr. Sharma, who's a big believer in the teachings of Swami Vivekananda, always says, "Yoga is not about touching your toes; it's about what you learn on the way down." So true!
normalised: My grandmother, Doctor Sharma, who's a big believer in the teachings of Swami Vivekananda, always says, "Yoga is not about touching your toes; it's about what you learn on the way down." So true!

unnormalised: I'm curious, how do *you* integrate yoga into your daily life beyond the asanas? Share your tips! Let's learn from each other. Also, any recommendations for good yoga retreats near Rishikesh? Thinking of going in December. Thanks in advance!
normalised: I'm curious, how do *you* integrate yoga into your daily life beyond the asanas? Share your tips! Let's learn from each other. Also, any recommendations for good yoga retreats near Rishikesh? Thinking of going in December. Thanks in advance!
